item.title: Goodrich Castle - Wikipedia
item.description: Goodrich Castle is a Norman medieval castle ruin north of the village of Goodrich in Herefordshire, England, controlling a key location between Monmouth and Ross-on-Wye.

item.title: Goodrich Castle | English Heritage
item.description: Enjoy this dreamy drone footage of Goodrich Castle and the beautiful surrounding countryside before you visit.

item.title: Goodrich Castle - History and Facts | History Hit
item.description: Goodrich Castle in Herefordshire is one of the most picturesque medieval ruins in the UK. Standing at the peak of a scenic woodland hilltop, this Norman fortification has attracted tourists to view its ethereal remains since the 18th century.

item.title: Goodrich Castle (English Heritage) - Visit Herefordshire
item.description: Standing in open countryside above the River Wye, Goodrich is one of the finest and best-preserved of all English medieval fortresses. Discover the castle's fascinating history, climb the battlements for breathtaking views, see the famous 'Roaring Meg', and enjoy an action-packed day out for all ages.

item.title: Goodrich Castle: A Storied Fortress of the Welsh Marches
item.description: Goodrich Castle, with its towering walls and turrets rising above the surrounding woodland, is a quintessential medieval fortress that has watched over the River Wye for nearly a millennium.

item.title: Goodrich Castle - Castle in Ross-On-Wye, Monmouth
item.description: This magnificent red sandstone castle, with a 12th century keep standing three stories high and extensive remains from the 13th and 14th centuries, looks across the beautiful Wye Valley to Symonds Yat.

item.title: Goodrich Castle | Get Tickets, Visitor Info | Castles History
item.description: Goodrich Castle is a Norman fortress in Herefordshire, England. The stone keep, which still stands, was erected around the 12th century. By the 13th century, the castle included luxury accommodations and numerous defences. Today, the ruins can be explored by booking a ticket through English Heritage. Parking.

item.title: Goodrich Castle | Historic Herefordshire Guide - Britain Express
item.description: Goodrich Castle is one of the finest examples of military architecture in England, located on a spur of land overlooking the River Wye, on the border with Wales. The castle is almost certainly named for Godric Mappestone (or Mappeson), who is mentioned in the Domesday Book as owning land in the area.

item.title: Goodrich Castle (2026) - All You MUST Know Before You Go (with Reviews)
item.description: Goodrich Castle offers multiple stunning views of the Welsh-English Border and some of the best rural land in Britain. A must visit. What a surprise to find a memorial to airborne radar developed during ww2.

item.title: Goodrich Castle - Defence Heritage
item.description: Goodrich Castle is one of the finest and best-preserved of all English medieval fortresses, majestically positioned in open countryside above the River Wye on the Herefordshire-Gloucestershire border.
